newsitem.title: MALAYSIA: Malaysia manufacturers' sales up 2.0 pct in Aug.
newsitem.headline: Malaysia manufacturers' sales up 2.0 pct in Aug.

text.p: Malaysia's manufacturing industries recorded combined sales worth 15.1 billion ringgit in August, up 2.0 percent on July and 10.2 percent over August 1995.

The figures, which resulted from a survey of 58 manufacturing industries involving 2,598 establishments, were released by the Statistics Department on Tuesday, the national Bernama news agency reported.
The sales value for the first eight months of the year was 116.8 billion ringgit, up 14.2 percent over the corresponding period a year earlier.

The department said 29 industries reported sales exceeding 800 million ringgit each for the January-August period. These included the manufacture of semi-conductors and communication equipment, radio and television sets, and motor vehicles.
Products showing big year-on-year output increases in the first eight months this year included welded iron and steel pipes, passenger cars, plywood and rubber gloves.
The establishments surveyed said they employed 846,336 workers at the end of August 1996, an increase of 8.0 percent over the same period last year.
